                           enableDictionary: bool = true;
    dictionaryPageSizeLimit: Option[int64] = none(int64);
                           batchSize: Option[int64] = none(int64);
                           maxRowGroupLength: Option[int64] = none(int64);
                           dataPageSize: Option[int64] = none(int64)): ParquetWriterProps {...}{.
    raises: [], tags: [].}
Construct a new parquet writer properties object, optionally overriding the default settings. 
proc newParquetWriter(schema: ArrowSchema; path: string; props: Option[
    ParquetWriterProps] = none(ParquetWriterProps)): ParquetWriter {...}{.
    raises: [IOError], tags: [].}
Construct a new parquet writer which will write to the local file at path. 
proc add(w: ParquetWriter; table: ArrowTable) {...}{.raises: [IOError], tags: [].}
Add this table to the parquet file being written. 
proc close(w: ParquetWriter) {...}{.raises: [IOError], tags: [].}
Close the parquet file for writing. NOTE: this MUST be called when done writing or the file will not be valid! This does not simply close the file descriptor, it finalizes the file by writing the parquet footer/metadata. 
proc toParquet(t: ArrowTable; path: string;
               props: Option[ParquetWriterProps] = none(ParquetWriterProps)) {...}{.
    raises: [IOError], tags: [].}
Write this table to a parquet file on the local filesystem at path. 
proc fromParquet(path: string): ArrowTable {...}{.raises: [IOError], tags: [].}
Read a parquet file from the local filesystem at path into a Table. 
proc newTypedParquetWriter[T: TypeRegistered](path: string;
    props: Option[ParquetWriterProps] = none(ParquetWriterProps)): TypedParquetWriter[
    T]
Create a new typed parquet writer, writing to local path path. 
proc add[T](w: TypedParquetWriter[T]; x: T)
Append an element to the parquet file being written. 
proc close[T](w: TypedParquetWriter[T])
Close the parquet file for writing. NOTE: this MUST be called when done writing or the file will not be valid! This does not simply close the file descriptor, it finalizes the file by writing the parquet footer/metadata. 
proc newParquetReader(path: string; useThreads: bool = true): ParquetReader {...}{.
    raises: [IOError], tags: [].}
Create a new parquet reader, reading the local path path. 
proc rowGroups(r: ParquetReader): int {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Return the number of row groups in the file being read. 
proc read(r: ParquetReader; rowGroup: int): ArrowTable {...}{.raises: [IOError],
    tags: [].}
Read the row group at index rowGroup as an ArrowTable. 
proc readFully(r: ParquetReader): ArrowTable {...}{.raises: [IOError], tags: [].}
Read the entire parquet file into an ArrowTable.
